instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMBUS_CHGR_SDA: What is SMBUS_CHGR_SDA? SMBUS_CHGR_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_CHGR_SCL: What is SMBUS_CHGR_SCL? SMBUS_CHGR_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus8.18V
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus8.18V
Should I start by replacing SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus8.18V
threads.message: Have you checked for communication between <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus8.18V
threads.message: Do you have green light??? <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high?? Voltage on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_CHGR_SCL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMBUS_CHGR_SDA</SIGNAL>??  Could be a bad ISL or bad SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus8.18V
threads.message: Figure out if the SMC is turning on first by measuring <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> before replacing it. If it isn't being told to leave reset mode then a new SMC will do the same thing as the present SMC!
